This weekly bulletin informs students, parents, and staff about internships, academic
programs, jobs, community service options, and leadership initiatives, along with
other student opportunities in a variety of fields. Please carefully note deadlines, age
requirements, and other pre-requisites for participation.
These various opportunities utilize different formats. Some are in-person, some
remote, and some have a hybrid arrangement. Check each program for their specific
format and schedule. Students should consider applying to any that match their
interests and talents. Some program deadlines are fast approaching – please do not
miss them!
For ease of use, these newsletters are organized by different categories, such as
Academic Programs, Business Internships & Jobs, STEM Opportunities, Community
Service, and so on.
Questions, suggestions, and information about other opportunities are always
welcome and appreciated, and may be sent to Internship/Opportunity Coordinator
Harvey Blumm at: hblumm@stuy.edu - we will share your helpful information with
the Stuy community!
There are a number of excellent opportunities in this issue with fast-approaching
deadlines - including (just to highlight a few):
EVENTS: Columbia’s Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory welcomes everyone to
their Open House on Saturday, 10/14 – free transportation from the upper west side
campus is available. And there are some upcoming college fairs & open houses (open
to all), including one for the CUNY Macaulay Honors Colleges (10/15), the NACAC
virtual college fair (10/15), and several SUNY College information sessions in
October and November.
ACADEMICS: Many colleges & universities offer free or low-cost one/two-day
SPLASH mini-course events for high school students. Classes include STEM and
Humanities subjects, and are usually taught by their students on campus (some have
virtual components). MIT, Yale, Johns Hopkins, Cornell and others have posted
information online – check the link in this section for an updated list.
BUSINESS: NYC Exploring welcomes all students to participate in their series of
after-school sessions with professionals from companies & organizations in a variety
of fields, including Business, Engineering, Law, Medicine, and more. New offerings
from M&T Bank and the KPMG accounting company have recently been added.
STEM: The Columbia Transcriptome Cell Biology Class and the Perry Initiative’s
Orthopedics/Engineering program (with separate virtual & in-person events) are
both excellent options for students with an interest in these areas of study.
Engineering/Architecture Deadline Approaching - all students interested in
engineering, architecture, design, and construction may apply for the upcoming ACE
Mentor weekly in-person partnership with a team of professionals from the Port
Authority – participants work with these PA professionals from a variety of fields.
